page.title: 10BOTANY AT BEAFORD
page.content: On a fine June day the children of Beaford School walked a footpath leading through North Harepath, Beaford Wood and on to Mill Road. They were looking for wild flowers and found these the most common:- Yarrow Honeysuckle Pennywort Toadflax Cow Parsley Willow Herb Cranesbill Wood Cow-wheat Clover Buttercups Hedge Wound-wort Red Campion Dog Rose Yellow Vetch Foxglove Periwinkle Valerian Speedwell In the interests of conservation of the country-side, local farmers and the local Council do not cut back hedge growth too often, and so allow these wild plants to mature and seed.
